title: Ticket #2780: Verify that GetProcessBirthday still works on Win7
description: if GetProcessBirthday is failing in Win7/Vista, then the ProcAPI's strategy of using pid,birthday tuples to regognise processes is horked. Need to Verify that GetProcessBirthday still works and add code to print out the birthday in the ProcAPI logging.
remarks:
2012-Feb-13 11:33:38 by johnkn:
I have verified that it works, although not for PID 0 or for PIDs for which we don't have the right to open and query.

The performance registry mechanism seems to work for all pids other than pid 0. But the ComparePidAge function has some flaws in the way it handles failure to open a process.

It is possible for PID re-use to result in a false positive from ComparePidAge because of the way it handles access denied.

2012-Feb-13 15:22:07 by tannenba:
Initial investigation by TJ : we are all good IF Condor is running as local system, but reporting bday of a pid could be broken if Condor is running as a personal Condor.
creator: johnkn
